Talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Now Gesane, this is my fault, not yours.


<sp:3:0:2:0500>I was too rosy with my estimates.
Talk_0037: <sp:3:0:2:0700>And with that, I'm off to Lookout Landing.
Talk_0038:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>All right. Work at Lookout Landing is
nearly wrapped up.<sp:0:4:0>Which also means I'm out of work...
You wouldn't know <clr:0000>anybody who needs
a carpenter<clr:ffff>, would you?
Talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm sorry, Karson. I wish we had more
building supplies for you to use.
Talk_0039:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS_00>Is that right?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>Well, if ever you need a guy who knows
his way around a hammer and nails, keep
me in mind!
Talk_0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease_00>We were so focused on gathering food
that we let our stockpile of building
materials go practically empty.
Talk_0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>There's some wood stockpiled at the
newspaper office, but not enough to
rebuild the bridge.
I guess our only option is to chop down
some of the trees around here... Urgh...
Talk_0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, Link. It's about the bridge job.


<sp:3:0:2:0300>We've hit a bit of a snag. See, the thing's
in worse shape than I accounted for.
Talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>We can't even scrounge up <clr:0000>20 pieces
of wood<clr:ffff>? It's shameful.<sp:0:4:0>Karson traveled all this way, and we have
nothing for him to work with.
Talk_0042:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Karson here estimates that we're short
<clr:0000>20 pieces of wood<clr:ffff>. Is that right?
Talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I had no idea this job would be so big that
it needed <clr:0000>20 pieces of wood<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>In retrospect, this is a bridge we're talking
about, so I guess it makes sense...
Talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Yep. We may be able to get what we
need by chopping down trees.

But that'll be a whole project in itself.
Talk_0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Hm? It's wood! 20 pieces of it!


Must've been a real pain in the neck
collecting that on your own. <sp:5:0:0>You sure I
can have it?
Talk_0050:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Aces! Thanks for helping me out
at such a late hour.
Talk_0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Aces! Thanks for helping me out
at such an early hour.
Talk_0052:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>With that done, life in Rito Village should
return to something like normal.

I will take responsibility for guarding the
bridge. Please, accept this gift.<sp:5:1:0>
Talk_0053:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I had that money set aside for repairing
the bridge, but I hope you'll get some use
out of it.
Talk_0054:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Naturally, I'm worried about <clr:0000>Princess<clr:ffff>
<clr:0000>Zelda <clr:ffff>being seen at Hyrule Castle.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But what can I do about it? At the end of
the day, I'm just a carpenter.
Talk_0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Come on, Gesane! Time to fix this busted
bridge of yours! Son and done!
Talk_0056: <sp:3:0:2:0c00>So what do we do? A sticky sitch, this.
Talk_0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Amazing! Fantastic! Now we can carry
supplies across!
Talk_0057:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Ah. <sp:5:1:0>The bridge job you told me about?
Sounds easy enough.

<sp:3:0:2:0000>I heard it fell apart when that blizzard
struck Rito Village.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>But if they're looking to have it fixed, that
strange weather must've died down, eh?

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Well then, no time to gab. <sp:5:0:0>I'll have that
bridge lookin' good as new in less than
no time! Son and done!
Talk_0028:
Gesane, let's plonk this down a little
farther to the left... <sp:5:1:0>Not that far!
Talk_0058:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I can't believe the bridge is in such a
sorry state...
Talk_0029: <sp:3:0:2:0701>And now, for the finishing touch!<sp:0:4:0><sp:5:1:0>Here goes...
Talk_0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_01>Now that the blizzard has passed,
I'd like to repair the bridge so that
supplies can arrive in the village.
Sadly, we're not equipped for a major
rebuilding project...<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0><clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:ffff>But I've heard there are <clr:0000>Hylians <clr:ffff>who are
skilled in construction.<sp:0:4:0>Say, you're a Hylian. Do you know anyone
who can help?
Talk_0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>I gotta say, I was a little worried about
how it'd turn out. But what a beaut!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>You could hit this bridge with 10
blizzards at once, and it wouldn't
so much as creak!
Talk_0060:
Pheeew! Good catch. <sp:5:1:0>Those wings sure
come in handy, eh? Or...wingy.
Talk_0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Gesane, if you ever need my help, just
say the word and I'll come running.
No problem's too small.
Talk_0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Trouble_01>Hmm. <sp:5:0:0>Sounds like you need a
good <clr:0000>carpenter<clr:ffff>.<clr:0000><sp:0:4:0><clr:ffff><sp:3:0:2:0701>I know! What about that guy at
<clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>If he could build an incredible structure
like that, I bet he'll have no problem fixing
up your bridge!
<sp:3:0:2:0500>His name was... <sp:5:1:0>Oh, shoot. I don't
remember. But it <clr:0000>ended in "son."<clr:ffff>
Talk_0061:
Hey, don't set your tail down there!<sp:5:0:0>
It's a support beam, not a perch!
Talk_0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Thank you. That's very reassuring.<sp:0:4:0>And the same goes for you. You have an
open invitation to call upon our help.
Talk_0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I bet the <clr:0000>carpenter<clr:ffff> at <clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>
will be able to restore this bridge.<sp:0:4:0>His name was... <sp:5:1:0>Um...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>Argh! It's on the tip of my tongue!<sp:0:4:0>There's no use. All I can remember for
sure is that it <clr:0000>ends in "son."<clr:ffff>
Talk_0062:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I appreciate the sentiment, but in this
case it's not the thought that counts.
It's the <clr:0000>wood<clr:ffff>. We need <clr:0000>20 pieces <clr:ffff>of it.
Perhaps we can get what we need by
chopping down trees here.

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But that's going to be a project in itself.
Talk_0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>A bridge connecting Hylians and the Rito,
literally and otherwise... <sp:5:1:0>This is gonna
make a great article!
Talk_0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>That's all right. The information you've
given me is enough to go on.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>If I could, I'd drop everything, head to
<clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>, and bring that Hylian
back here.
However, my defense duties come first.
I have to stay here for now and ensure
the village is safe.<sp:5:0:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Then again, a broken bridge is hardly
"safe," either. What to do...
Talk_0063:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>We may be able to get what we need from
the trees around here.

But to get all that lumber, we'll be
chopping for days...
Talk_0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>Fantastic! Yes, he sounds up to the task.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>However, I can't leave the village right
now, what with my defense duties.<sp:0:4:0>We'll have to dispatch an emissary to
<clr:0000>Lookout Landing <clr:ffff>in my place.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c00>But who to send? Everyone's so busy...
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>They need someone to rebuild their
bridge, huh? <sp:5:0:0>Sounds easy enough.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>I heard it fell apart when that blizzard
struck Rito Village.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>But if they're looking to have it fixed, that
strange weather must've died down, eh?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Well then, no time to gab. <sp:5:0:0>I'll have that
bridge lookin' good as new in less than
no time! Son and done!
Talk_0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Aces! Thanks for helping me out
in this rain.
